Wishing a safe and joyous holiday to all who celebrate. I send well wishes to the men and women in uniform celebrating abroad, to caregivers, and public safety officials who sacrifice time with their loved ones this season in service to others. #MerryChristmas

The #SECUREAct includes my priorities to:
-Expand access to retirement plans for part-time workers
-Improve benefits for volunteer firefighters & EMS workers
-Delay the age for required minimum distributions
-Protect benefits for older workers in closed defined benefit plans

48% of Americans over 55 have no retirement saved. Everyone deserves a dignified retirement after a lifetime of work. Today, we have a chance to pass the #SECUREAct in the FY20 spending bill and ensure all hard-working citizens can plan for their futures pic.twitter.com/zE4oakJkY3

We live in a country where classrom lockdown drills are standard and firearms are the second leading cause of death for children and teens. This is unacceptable. Addressing gun safety is common sense. We have to act to end these tragedies.

Now that the #FUTUREAct is across the finish line, we must continue to work together on a reauthorization of the Higher Education Act to provide more support for students and expand college access for all.

Proud that the #FUTUREAct finally passed Congress! This deal secures permanent funding for #HBCUs, simplifies FAFSA & reduces burdens on students working to repay loans. This is a win for Maryland’s 4 HBCUs & the students working toward their dreams. https://www.politico.com/newsletters/morning-education/2019/12/11/congress-passes-hbcu-funding-student-aid-simplification-783574 …

Only a few more weeks until the new year which means the #2020Census will soon be underway! The Census is how we plan for the future, fund schools, roads & hospitals, and represent our voices in government. Learn how you can get involved and #GetCounted at  http://2020census.gov

The @USTreasury today designated 18 individuals in Burma, Pakistan, Libya, Slovakia, the DRC & South Sudan for human rights violations and corruption under the Global Magnitsky Act. On #HumanRightsDay & every day, we must hold perpetrators accountable.
 https://home.treasury.gov/news/press-releases/sm852 …

On International #HumanRightsDay , we recall the words of John F. Kennedy: “The rights of every man are diminished when the rights of one man are threatened.”  

The US has a duty to speak out whenever and wherever these rights are endangered. pic.twitter.com/1DOzQF8SDS

Stephen Miller should have been fired long ago. Neither he nor his hateful ideologies should have a home in our Executive Branch or US policy agenda. I have called for his resignation and I will continue to fight against the dangerous policies that he has helped create.

It’s been 2 years since the Trump Admin repealed #NetNeutrality . The internet is a public utility. Students, #smallbiz owners & consumers nationwide rely on it remaining free, open & equitable. We must fight to pass the #SaveTheInternet Act to restore the open internet for all.

I authored the Global Magnitsky Act to hold perpetrators of violence and corruption accountable for their crimes.

On #AntiCorruptionDay, I'm pleased that the Treasury has issued sanctions against corrupt leaders in Venezuela.
 https://home.treasury.gov/news/press-releases/sm849 …

Today, is International #AntiCorruptionDay a reminder that corruption anywhere erodes trust in democracies everywhere.

It compromises the rule of law & fuels exploitative labor, human trafficking and rights abuses. We must all take up the charge to preserve our values & humanity pic.twitter.com/I2Xlkzgwew

Today we remember the day that lives in infamy & honor the memory of the brave heroes who lost their lives at Pearl Harbor 78 years ago. 

This day launched the US into WWII & fortified our resolve to come together with our allies to fight for our values and the common good.

Mourning the victims of the shootings at the Pensacola Naval Air Station today and Pearl Harbor Naval Shipyard earlier this week. My thoughts are with their loved ones and all the military families whose lives have been touched by these tragedies.
